com.solacesystems.jcsmp

Interface Consumer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    FlowReceiver, XMLMessageConsumer

    @ProviderType
public interface Consumer
    Consumer objects are used to receive messages from the Solace Messaging Platform.

    Note: Applications must cache this instance, and close it only when it is no longer required.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the message consumer, rendering it unusable.
      boolean isClosed()
      Checks if message consumer is closed
      BytesXMLMessage receive()
      Receives the next available message, waiting until one is available.
      BytesXMLMessage receive(int timeoutInMillis)
      Receives the next available message.
      BytesXMLMessage receiveNoWait()
      Receives the next available message.
      void start()
      Enables receiving messages from an appliance.
      void stop()
      Disables receiving messages from an appliance.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        void close()
        Closes the message consumer, rendering it unusable.

        Once closed, an application acquires a new instance in order to continue to receive messages.

        New messages will not be processed and delivered after a call to close() returns, although it is possible for a single asynchronous message delivery to occur if it has already begun when close() is called.

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
        Checks if message consumer is closed
        Returns:
        true if message consumer is closed, false otherwise

      • start

        void start()
    throws JCSMPException
        Enables receiving messages from an appliance.
        Throws:
        JCSMPException - upon error
        InvalidOperationException - when called on a closed consumer.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Disables receiving messages from an appliance.

        Note that there is no guarantee the effect of calling stop() will be instantaneous: messages already in-flight or being processed by the API may still be delivered after the call to stop() returns.

      • receive

        BytesXMLMessage receive()
                 throws JCSMPException
        Receives the next available message, waiting until one is available.

        Returns:
        The next available message, or null if it is interrupted.
        Throws:
        InvalidOperationException - If the consumer is not started, or a message listener is set.
        JCSMPTransportException - If the consumer was closed after the function was called, but before any message was received.
        JCSMPException

      • receive

        BytesXMLMessage receive(int timeoutInMillis)
                 throws JCSMPException
        Receives the next available message. If no message is available, this method blocks until timeoutInMillis is reached. A timeout of zero never expires, and the call blocks indefinitely.

        Parameters:
        timeoutInMillis - The timeout in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        The next available message, or null if the timeout expires.
        Throws:
        InvalidOperationException - If the consumer is not started, or a message listener is set.
        JCSMPTransportException - If the consumer was closed after the method was called, but before any message was received.
        JCSMPException

      • receiveNoWait

        BytesXMLMessage receiveNoWait()
                       throws JCSMPException
        Receives the next available message. If no message is available, this method returns null immediately.
        Returns:
        The next available message, or null if one is not available.
        Throws:
        InvalidOperationException - If the consumer is not started, or a message listener is set.
        JCSMPTransportException - If the consumer was closed after the function was called but before any message was received.
        JCSMPException
